78  /**
79   * HLog stores all the edits to the HStore.  Its the hbase write-ahead-log
80   * implementation.
81   *
82   * It performs logfile-rolling, so external callers are not aware that the
83   * underlying file is being rolled.
84   *
85   * <p>
86   * There is one HLog per RegionServer.  All edits for all Regions carried by
87   * a particular RegionServer are entered first in the HLog.
88   *
89   * <p>
90   * Each HRegion is identified by a unique long <code>int</code>. HRegions do
91   * not need to declare themselves before using the HLog; they simply include
92   * their HRegion-id in the <code>append</code> or
93   * <code>completeCacheFlush</code> calls.
94   *
95   * <p>
96   * An HLog consists of multiple on-disk files, which have a chronological order.
97   * As data is flushed to other (better) on-disk structures, the log becomes
98   * obsolete. We can destroy all the log messages for a given HRegion-id up to
99   * the most-recent CACHEFLUSH message from that HRegion.
100  *
101  * <p>
102  * It's only practical to delete entire files. Thus, we delete an entire on-disk
103  * file F when all of the messages in F have a log-sequence-id that's older
104  * (smaller) than the most-recent CACHEFLUSH message for every HRegion that has
105  * a message in F.
106  *
107  * <p>
108  * Synchronized methods can never execute in parallel. However, between the
109  * start of a cache flush and the completion point, appends are allowed but log
110  * rolling is not. To prevent log rolling taking place during this period, a
111  * separate reentrant lock is used.
112  *
113  * <p>To read an HLog, call {@link #getReader(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem,
114  * org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration)}.
115  *
116  */
117 public class HLog implements Syncable {
118   static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(HLog.class);
119   public static final byte [] METAFAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("METAFAMILY");
120   static final byte [] METAROW = Bytes.toBytes("METAROW");
121 
122   /** File Extension used while splitting an HLog into regions (HBASE-2312) */
123   public static final String SPLITTING_EXT = "-splitting";
124   public static final boolean SPLIT_SKIP_ERRORS_DEFAULT = false;
125

127    * Name of directory that holds recovered edits written by the wal log
128    * splitting code, one per region

131   private static final Pattern EDITFILES_NAME_PATTERN =
132     Pattern.compile("-?[0-9]+");
133   public static final String RECOVERED_LOG_TMPFILE_SUFFIX = ".temp";

167   public interface Reader {
168     void init(FileSystem fs, Path path, Configuration c) throws IOException;
169     void close() throws IOException;
170     Entry next() throws IOException;
171     Entry next(Entry reuse) throws IOException;
172     void seek(long pos) throws IOException;
173     long getPosition() throws IOException;
174     void reset() throws IOException;
175   }
176 
177   public interface Writer {
178     void init(FileSystem fs, Path path, Configuration c) throws IOException;
179     void close() throws IOException;
180     void sync() throws IOException;
181     void append(Entry entry) throws IOException;
182     long getLength() throws IOException;
183   }

196   /*
197    * Map of encoded region names to their most recent sequence/edit id in their
198    * memstore.
199    */
200   private final ConcurrentSkipListMap<byte [], Long> lastSeqWritten =
201     new ConcurrentSkipListMap<byte [], Long>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
202 
203   private volatile boolean closed = false;
204 
205   private final AtomicLong logSeqNum = new AtomicLong(0);
206 
207   // The timestamp (in ms) when the log file was created.
208   private volatile long filenum = -1;
209 
210   //number of transactions in the current Hlog.
211   private final AtomicInteger numEntries = new AtomicInteger(0);
212 
213   // If live datanode count is lower than the default replicas value,
214   // RollWriter will be triggered in each sync(So the RollWriter will be
215   // triggered one by one in a short time). Using it as a workaround to slow
216   // down the roll frequency triggered by checkLowReplication().
217   private volatile int consecutiveLogRolls = 0;
218   private final int lowReplicationRollLimit;
219 
220   // If consecutiveLogRolls is larger than lowReplicationRollLimit,
221   // then disable the rolling in checkLowReplication().
222   // Enable it if the replications recover.
223   private volatile boolean lowReplicationRollEnabled = true;
224 
225   // If > than this size, roll the log. This is typically 0.95 times the size
226   // of the default Hdfs block size.
227   private final long logrollsize;
228 
229   // This lock prevents starting a log roll during a cache flush.
230   // synchronized is insufficient because a cache flush spans two method calls.
231   private final Lock cacheFlushLock = new ReentrantLock();
232 
233   // We synchronize on updateLock to prevent updates and to prevent a log roll
234   // during an update
235   // locked during appends
236   private final Object updateLock = new Object();
237   private final Object flushLock = new Object();
238 
239   private final boolean enabled;
240 
241   /*
242    * If more than this many logs, force flush of oldest region to oldest edit
243    * goes to disk.  If too many and we crash, then will take forever replaying.
244    * Keep the number of logs tidy.
245    */
246   private final int maxLogs;
247 
248   /**
249    * Thread that handles optional sync'ing
250    */
251   private final LogSyncer logSyncer;
252 
253   /** Number of log close errors tolerated before we abort */
254   private final int closeErrorsTolerated;
255 
256   private final AtomicInteger closeErrorCount = new AtomicInteger();

259    * Pattern used to validate a HLog file name

261   private static final Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(".*\\.\\d*");

263   static byte [] COMPLETE_CACHE_FLUSH;
264   static {
265     try {
266       COMPLETE_CACHE_FLUSH =
267         "HBASE::CACHEFLUSH".getBytes(HConstants.UTF8_ENCODING);
268     } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
269       assert(false);
270     }
271   }

273   public static class Metric {
274     public long min = Long.MAX_VALUE;
275     public long max = 0;
276     public long total = 0;
277     public int count = 0;
278 
279     synchronized void inc(final long val) {
280       min = Math.min(min, val);
281       max = Math.max(max, val);
282       total += val;
283       ++count;
284     }
285 
286     synchronized Metric get() {
287       Metric copy = new Metric();
288       copy.min = min;
289       copy.max = max;
290       copy.total = total;
291       copy.count = count;
292       this.min = Long.MAX_VALUE;
293       this.max = 0;
294       this.total = 0;
295       this.count = 0;
296       return copy;
297     }
298   }
299 
300   // For measuring latency of writes
301   private static Metric writeTime = new Metric();
302   private static Metric writeSize = new Metric();
303   // For measuring latency of syncs
304   private static Metric syncTime = new Metric();
305   //For measuring slow HLog appends
306   private static AtomicLong slowHLogAppendCount = new AtomicLong();
307   private static Metric slowHLogAppendTime = new Metric();
308   
309   public static Metric getWriteTime() {

322     return slowHLogAppendCount.get();

326     return slowHLogAppendTime.get();

329   /**
330    * Constructor.
331    *
332    * @param fs filesystem handle
333    * @param dir path to where hlogs are stored
334    * @param oldLogDir path to where hlogs are archived
335    * @param conf configuration to use
336    * @throws IOException
337    */
338   public HLog(final FileSystem fs, final Path dir, final Path oldLogDir,
339               final Configuration conf)
340   throws IOException {
341     this(fs, dir, oldLogDir, conf, null, true, null);
342   }
343 
344   /**
345    * Create an edit log at the given <code>dir</code> location.
346    *
347    * You should never have to load an existing log. If there is a log at
348    * startup, it should have already been processed and deleted by the time the
349    * HLog object is started up.
350    *
351    * @param fs filesystem handle
352    * @param dir path to where hlogs are stored
353    * @param oldLogDir path to where hlogs are archived
354    * @param conf configuration to use
355    * @param listeners Listeners on WAL events. Listeners passed here will
356    * be registered before we do anything else; e.g. the
357    * Constructor {@link #rollWriter()}.
358    * @param prefix should always be hostname and port in distributed env and
359    *        it will be URL encoded before being used.
360    *        If prefix is null, "hlog" will be used
361    * @throws IOException
362    */
363   public HLog(final FileSystem fs, final Path dir, final Path oldLogDir,
364       final Configuration conf, final List<WALActionsListener> listeners,
365       final String prefix) throws IOException {
366     this(fs, dir, oldLogDir, conf, listeners, true, prefix);
367   }
368 
369   /**
370    * Create an edit log at the given <code>dir</code> location.
371    *
372    * You should never have to load an existing log. If there is a log at
373    * startup, it should have already been processed and deleted by the time the
374    * HLog object is started up.
375    *
376    * @param fs filesystem handle
377    * @param dir path to where hlogs are stored
378    * @param oldLogDir path to where hlogs are archived
379    * @param conf configuration to use
380    * @param listeners Listeners on WAL events. Listeners passed here will
381    * be registered before we do anything else; e.g. the
382    * Constructor {@link #rollWriter()}.
383    * @param failIfLogDirExists If true IOException will be thrown if dir already exists.
384    * @param prefix should always be hostname and port in distributed env and
385    *        it will be URL encoded before being used.
386    *        If prefix is null, "hlog" will be used
387    * @throws IOException
388    */
389   public HLog(final FileSystem fs, final Path dir, final Path oldLogDir,
390       final Configuration conf, final List<WALActionsListener> listeners,
391       final boolean failIfLogDirExists, final String prefix)
392   throws IOException {
393     super();
394     this.fs = fs;
395     this.dir = dir;
396     this.conf = conf;
397     this.hlogFs = new HLogFileSystem(conf);
398     if (listeners != null) {
399       for (WALActionsListener i: listeners) {
400         registerWALActionsListener(i);
401       }
402     }
403     this.blocksize = conf.getLong("hbase.regionserver.hlog.blocksize",
404         FSUtils.getDefaultBlockSize(this.fs, this.dir));
405     // Roll at 95% of block size.
406     float multi = conf.getFloat("hbase.regionserver.logroll.multiplier", 0.95f);
407     this.logrollsize = (long)(this.blocksize * multi);
408     this.optionalFlushInterval =
409       conf.getLong("hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval", 1 * 1000);
410     if (failIfLogDirExists && fs.exists(dir)) {
411       throw new IOException("Target HLog directory already exists: " + dir);
412     }
413     if (!HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, dir)) {
414       throw new IOException("Unable to mkdir " + dir);
415     }
416     this.oldLogDir = oldLogDir;
417     if (!fs.exists(oldLogDir) && !HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, oldLogDir)) {
418       throw new IOException("Unable to mkdir " + this.oldLogDir);
419     }
420     this.maxLogs = conf.getInt("hbase.regionserver.maxlogs", 32);
421     this.minTolerableReplication = conf.getInt(
422         "hbase.regionserver.hlog.tolerable.lowreplication",
423         FSUtils.getDefaultReplication(this.fs, this.dir));
424     this.lowReplicationRollLimit = conf.getInt(
425         "hbase.regionserver.hlog.lowreplication.rolllimit", 5);
426     this.enabled = conf.getBoolean("hbase.regionserver.hlog.enabled", true);
427     this.closeErrorsTolerated = conf.getInt(
428         "hbase.regionserver.logroll.errors.tolerated", 0);
429 
430     LOG.info("HLog configuration: blocksize=" +
431       StringUtils.byteDesc(this.blocksize) +
432       ", rollsize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(this.logrollsize) +
433       ", enabled=" + this.enabled +
434       ", optionallogflushinternal=" + this.optionalFlushInterval + "ms");
435     // If prefix is null||empty then just name it hlog
436     this.prefix = prefix == null || prefix.isEmpty() ?
437         "hlog" : URLEncoder.encode(prefix, "UTF8");
438     // rollWriter sets this.hdfs_out if it can.
439     rollWriter();
440 
441     // handle the reflection necessary to call getNumCurrentReplicas()
442     this.getNumCurrentReplicas = getGetNumCurrentReplicas(this.hdfs_out);
443 
444     logSyncer = new LogSyncer(this.optionalFlushInterval);
445     // When optionalFlushInterval is set as 0, don't start a thread for deferred log sync.
446     if (this.optionalFlushInterval > 0) {
447       Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning(logSyncer.getThread(), Thread.currentThread().getName()
448           + ".logSyncer");
449     } else {
450       LOG.info("hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval is set as "
451           + this.optionalFlushInterval + ". Deferred log syncing won't work. "
452           + "Any Mutation, marked to be deferred synced, will be flushed immediately.");
453     }
454     coprocessorHost = new WALCoprocessorHost(this, conf);
455   }
456 
457   /**
458    * Find the 'getNumCurrentReplicas' on the passed <code>os</code> stream.
459    * @return Method or null.
460    */
461   private Method getGetNumCurrentReplicas(final FSDataOutputStream os) {
462     Method m = null;
463     if (os != null) {
464       Class<? extends OutputStream> wrappedStreamClass = os.getWrappedStream()
465           .getClass();
466       try {
467         m = wrappedStreamClass.getDeclaredMethod("getNumCurrentReplicas",
468             new Class<?>[] {});
469         m.setAccessible(true);
470       } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
471         LOG.info("FileSystem's output stream doesn't support"
472             + " getNumCurrentReplicas; --HDFS-826 not available; fsOut="
473             + wrappedStreamClass.getName());
474       } catch (SecurityException e) {
475         LOG.info("Doesn't have access to getNumCurrentReplicas on "
476             + "FileSystems's output stream --HDFS-826 not available; fsOut="
477             + wrappedStreamClass.getName(), e);
478         m = null; // could happen on setAccessible()
479       }
480     }
481     if (m != null) {
482       LOG.info("Using getNumCurrentReplicas--HDFS-826");
483     }
484     return m;
485   }
486 
487   public void registerWALActionsListener(final WALActionsListener listener) {
488     this.listeners.add(listener);
489   }
490 
491   public boolean unregisterWALActionsListener(final WALActionsListener listener) {
492     return this.listeners.remove(listener);
493   }

495   /**
496    * @return Current state of the monotonically increasing file id.
497    */
498   public long getFilenum() {
499     return this.filenum;
500   }
501 
502   /**
503    * Called by HRegionServer when it opens a new region to ensure that log
504    * sequence numbers are always greater than the latest sequence number of the
505    * region being brought on-line.
506    *
507    * @param newvalue We'll set log edit/sequence number to this value if it
508    * is greater than the current value.
509    */
510   public void setSequenceNumber(final long newvalue) {
511     for (long id = this.logSeqNum.get(); id < newvalue &&
512         !this.logSeqNum.compareAndSet(id, newvalue); id = this.logSeqNum.get()) {
513       // This could spin on occasion but better the occasional spin than locking
514       // every increment of sequence number.
515       LOG.debug("Changed sequenceid from " + logSeqNum + " to " + newvalue);
516     }
517   }
518 
519   /**
520    * @return log sequence number
521    */
522   public long getSequenceNumber() {
523     return logSeqNum.get();
524   }
525 
526   /**
527    * Method used internal to this class and for tests only.
528    * @return The wrapped stream our writer is using; its not the
529    * writer's 'out' FSDatoOutputStream but the stream that this 'out' wraps
530    * (In hdfs its an instance of DFSDataOutputStream).
531    */
532   // usage: see TestLogRolling.java
533   OutputStream getOutputStream() {
534     return this.hdfs_out.getWrappedStream();
535   }
536 
537   /**
538    * Roll the log writer. That is, start writing log messages to a new file.
539    *
540    * Because a log cannot be rolled during a cache flush, and a cache flush
541    * spans two method calls, a special lock needs to be obtained so that a cache
542    * flush cannot start when the log is being rolled and the log cannot be
543    * rolled during a cache flush.
544    *
545    * <p>Note that this method cannot be synchronized because it is possible that
546    * startCacheFlush runs, obtaining the cacheFlushLock, then this method could
547    * start which would obtain the lock on this but block on obtaining the
548    * cacheFlushLock and then completeCacheFlush could be called which would wait
549    * for the lock on this and consequently never release the cacheFlushLock
550    *
551    * @return If lots of logs, flush the returned regions so next time through
552    * we can clean logs. Returns null if nothing to flush.  Names are actual
553    * region names as returned by {@link HRegionInfo#getEncodedName()}
554    * @throws org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.FailedLogCloseException
555    * @throws IOException
556    */
557   public byte [][] rollWriter() throws FailedLogCloseException, IOException {
558     return rollWriter(false);
559   }
560 
561   /**
562    * Roll the log writer. That is, start writing log messages to a new file.
563    *
564    * Because a log cannot be rolled during a cache flush, and a cache flush
565    * spans two method calls, a special lock needs to be obtained so that a cache
566    * flush cannot start when the log is being rolled and the log cannot be
567    * rolled during a cache flush.
568    *
569    * <p>Note that this method cannot be synchronized because it is possible that
570    * startCacheFlush runs, obtaining the cacheFlushLock, then this method could
571    * start which would obtain the lock on this but block on obtaining the
572    * cacheFlushLock and then completeCacheFlush could be called which would wait
573    * for the lock on this and consequently never release the cacheFlushLock
574    *
575    * @param force If true, force creation of a new writer even if no entries
576    * have been written to the current writer
577    * @return If lots of logs, flush the returned regions so next time through
578    * we can clean logs. Returns null if nothing to flush.  Names are actual
579    * region names as returned by {@link HRegionInfo#getEncodedName()}
580    * @throws org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.FailedLogCloseException
581    * @throws IOException
582    */
583   public byte [][] rollWriter(boolean force)
584       throws FailedLogCloseException, IOException {
585     // Return if nothing to flush.
586     if (!force && this.writer != null && this.numEntries.get() <= 0) {
587       return null;
588     }
589     byte [][] regionsToFlush = null;
590     this.cacheFlushLock.lock();
591     this.logRollRunning = true;
592     try {
593       if (closed) {
594         LOG.debug("HLog closed.  Skipping rolling of writer");
595         return regionsToFlush;
596       }
597       // Do all the preparation outside of the updateLock to block
598       // as less as possible the incoming writes
599       long currentFilenum = this.filenum;
600       Path oldPath = null;
601       if (currentFilenum > 0) {
602         oldPath = computeFilename(currentFilenum);
603       }
604       this.filenum = System.currentTimeMillis();
605       Path newPath = computeFilename();
606 
607       // Tell our listeners that a new log is about to be created
608       if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
609         for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
610           i.preLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
611         }
612       }
613       HLog.Writer nextWriter = this.createWriterInstance(fs, newPath, conf);
614       // Can we get at the dfsclient outputstream?  If an instance of
615       // SFLW, it'll have done the necessary reflection to get at the
616       // protected field name.
617       FSDataOutputStream nextHdfsOut = null;
618       if (nextWriter instanceof SequenceFileLogWriter) {
619         nextHdfsOut = ((SequenceFileLogWriter)nextWriter).getWriterFSDataOutputStream();
620       }
621 
622       synchronized (updateLock) {
623         // Clean up current writer.
624         Path oldFile = cleanupCurrentWriter(currentFilenum);
625         this.writer = nextWriter;
626         this.hdfs_out = nextHdfsOut;
627 
628         LOG.info((oldFile != null?
629             "Roll " + FSUtils.getPath(oldFile) + ", entries=" +
630             this.numEntries.get() +
631             ", filesize=" +
632             this.fs.getFileStatus(oldFile).getLen() + ". ": "") +
633           " for " + FSUtils.getPath(newPath));
634         this.numEntries.set(0);
635       }
636       // Tell our listeners that a new log was created
637       if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
638         for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
639           i.postLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
640         }
641       }
642 
643       // Can we delete any of the old log files?
644       if (this.outputfiles.size() > 0) {
645         if (this.lastSeqWritten.isEmpty()) {
646           LOG.debug("Last sequenceid written is empty. Deleting all old hlogs");
647           // If so, then no new writes have come in since all regions were
648           // flushed (and removed from the lastSeqWritten map). Means can
649           // remove all but currently open log file.
650           for (Map.Entry<Long, Path> e : this.outputfiles.entrySet()) {
651             archiveLogFile(e.getValue(), e.getKey());
652           }
653           this.outputfiles.clear();
654         } else {
655           regionsToFlush = cleanOldLogs();
656         }
657       }
658     } finally {
659       this.logRollRunning = false;
660       this.cacheFlushLock.unlock();
661     }
662     return regionsToFlush;
663   }
664 
665   /**
666    * This method allows subclasses to inject different writers without having to
667    * extend other methods like rollWriter().
668    * 
669    * @param fs
670    * @param path
671    * @param conf
672    * @return Writer instance
673    * @throws IOException
674    */
675   protected Writer createWriterInstance(final FileSystem fs, final Path path,
676       final Configuration conf) throws IOException {
677     return this.hlogFs.createWriter(fs, conf, path);
678   }
679 
680   /**
681    * Get a reader for the WAL.
682    * The proper way to tail a log that can be under construction is to first use this method
683    * to get a reader then call {@link HLog.Reader#reset()} to see the new data. It will also
684    * take care of keeping implementation-specific context (like compression).
685    * @param fs
686    * @param path
687    * @param conf
688    * @return A WAL reader.  Close when done with it.
689    * @throws IOException
690    */
691   public static Reader getReader(final FileSystem fs, final Path path,
692       Configuration conf) throws IOException {
693     return getReader(fs, path, conf, null);
694   }
695 
696   public static Reader getReader(final FileSystem fs, final Path path,
697         Configuration conf, CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
698     if (logReaderClass == null) {
699       logReaderClass = conf.getClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.reader.impl",
700         SequenceFileLogReader.class, Reader.class);
701     }
702 
703     try {
704       // A hlog file could be under recovery, so it may take several
705       // tries to get it open. Instead of claiming it is corrupted, retry
706       // to open it up to 5 minutes by default.
707       long startWaiting = System.currentTimeMillis();
708       long openTimeout = conf.getInt("hbase.hlog.open.timeout", 300000) + startWaiting;
709       int nbAttempt = 0;
710       while (true) {
711         try {
712           HLog.Reader reader = logReaderClass.newInstance();
713           reader.init(fs, path, conf);
714           return reader;
715         } catch (IOException e) {
716           String msg = e.getMessage();
717             if (msg != null && (msg.contains("Cannot obtain block length")
718                 || msg.contains("Could not obtain the last block")
719                 || msg.matches("Blocklist for [^ ]* has changed.*"))) {
720             if (++nbAttempt == 1) {
721               LOG.warn("Lease should have recovered. This is not expected. Will retry", e);
722             }
723             if (reporter != null && !reporter.progress()) {
724               throw new InterruptedIOException("Operation is cancelled");
725             }
726             if (nbAttempt > 2 && openTimeout < System.currentTimeMillis()) {
727               LOG.error("Can't open after " + nbAttempt + " attempts and "
728                 + (System.currentTimeMillis() - startWaiting)
729                 + "ms " + " for " + path);
730             } else {
731               try {
732                 Thread.sleep(nbAttempt < 3 ? 500 : 1000);
733                 continue; // retry
734               } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
735                 InterruptedIOException iioe = new InterruptedIOException();
736                 iioe.initCause(ie);
737                 throw iioe;
738               }
739             }
740           }
741           throw e;
742         }
743       }
744     } catch (IOException ie) {
745       throw ie;
746     } catch (Exception e) {
747       throw new IOException("Cannot get log reader", e);
748     }
749   }
750 
751   /**
752    * Get a writer for the WAL.
753    * @param path
754    * @param conf
755    * @return A WAL writer.  Close when done with it.
756    * @throws IOException
757    */
758   public static Writer createWriter(final FileSystem fs,
759       final Path path, Configuration conf)
760   throws IOException {
761     try {
762       if (logWriterClass == null) {
763         logWriterClass = conf.getClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.writer.impl",
764             SequenceFileLogWriter.class, Writer.class);
765       }
766       HLog.Writer writer = (HLog.Writer) logWriterClass.newInstance();
767       writer.init(fs, path, conf);
768       return writer;
769     } catch (Exception e) {
770       throw new IOException("cannot get log writer", e);
771     }
772   }
773 
774   /*
775    * Clean up old commit logs.
776    * @return If lots of logs, flush the returned region so next time through
777    * we can clean logs. Returns null if nothing to flush.  Returns array of
778    * encoded region names to flush.
779    * @throws IOException
780    */
781   private byte [][] cleanOldLogs() throws IOException {
782     Long oldestOutstandingSeqNum = getOldestOutstandingSeqNum();
783     // Get the set of all log files whose last sequence number is smaller than
784     // the oldest edit's sequence number.
785     TreeSet<Long> sequenceNumbers =
786       new TreeSet<Long>(this.outputfiles.headMap(
787         (Long.valueOf(oldestOutstandingSeqNum.longValue()))).keySet());
788     // Now remove old log files (if any)
789     int logsToRemove = sequenceNumbers.size();
790     if (logsToRemove > 0) {
791       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
792         // Find associated region; helps debugging.
793         byte [] oldestRegion = getOldestRegion(oldestOutstandingSeqNum);
794         LOG.debug("Found " + logsToRemove + " hlogs to remove" +
795           " out of total " + this.outputfiles.size() + ";" +
796           " oldest outstanding sequenceid is " + oldestOutstandingSeqNum +
797           " from region " + Bytes.toStringBinary(oldestRegion));
798       }
799       for (Long seq : sequenceNumbers) {
800         archiveLogFile(this.outputfiles.remove(seq), seq);
801       }
802     }
803 
804     // If too many log files, figure which regions we need to flush.
805     // Array is an array of encoded region names.
806     byte [][] regions = null;
807     int logCount = this.outputfiles == null? 0: this.outputfiles.size();
808     if (logCount > this.maxLogs && logCount > 0) {
809       // This is an array of encoded region names.
810       regions = findMemstoresWithEditsEqualOrOlderThan(this.outputfiles.firstKey(),
811         this.lastSeqWritten);
812       if (regions != null) {
813         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
814         for (int i = 0; i < regions.length; i++) {
815           if (i > 0) sb.append(", ");
816           sb.append(Bytes.toStringBinary(regions[i]));
817         }
818         LOG.info("Too many hlogs: logs=" + logCount + ", maxlogs=" +
819            this.maxLogs + "; forcing flush of " + regions.length + " regions(s): " +
820            sb.toString());
821       }
822     }
823     return regions;
824   }
825 
826   /**
827    * Return regions (memstores) that have edits that are equal or less than
828    * the passed <code>oldestWALseqid</code>.
829    * @param oldestWALseqid
830    * @param regionsToSeqids Encoded region names to sequence ids
831    * @return All regions whose seqid is < than <code>oldestWALseqid</code> (Not
832    * necessarily in order).  Null if no regions found.
833    */
834   static byte [][] findMemstoresWithEditsEqualOrOlderThan(final long oldestWALseqid,
835       final Map<byte [], Long> regionsToSeqids) {
836     //  This method is static so it can be unit tested the easier.
837     List<byte []> regions = null;
838     for (Map.Entry<byte [], Long> e: regionsToSeqids.entrySet()) {
839       if (e.getValue().longValue() <= oldestWALseqid) {
840         if (regions == null) regions = new ArrayList<byte []>();
841         // Key is encoded region name.
842         regions.add(e.getKey());
843       }
844     }
845     return regions == null?
846       null: regions.toArray(new byte [][] {HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY});
847   }
848 
849   /*
850    * @return Logs older than this id are safe to remove.
851    */
852   private Long getOldestOutstandingSeqNum() {
853     return Collections.min(this.lastSeqWritten.values());
854   }
855 
856   /**
857    * @param oldestOutstandingSeqNum
858    * @return (Encoded) name of oldest outstanding region.
859    */
860   private byte [] getOldestRegion(final Long oldestOutstandingSeqNum) {
861     byte [] oldestRegion = null;
862     for (Map.Entry<byte [], Long> e: this.lastSeqWritten.entrySet()) {
863       if (e.getValue().longValue() == oldestOutstandingSeqNum.longValue()) {
864         // Key is encoded region name.
865         oldestRegion = e.getKey();
866         break;
867       }
868     }
869     return oldestRegion;
870   }
871 
872   /*
873    * Cleans up current writer closing and adding to outputfiles.
874    * Presumes we're operating inside an updateLock scope.
875    * @return Path to current writer or null if none.
876    * @throws IOException
877    */
878   Path cleanupCurrentWriter(final long currentfilenum) throws IOException {
879     Path oldFile = null;
880     if (this.writer != null) {
881       // Close the current writer, get a new one.
882       try {
883         // Wait till all current transactions are written to the hlog.
884         // No new transactions can occur because we have the updatelock.
885         if (this.unflushedEntries.get() != this.syncedTillHere) {
886           LOG.debug("cleanupCurrentWriter " +
887                    " waiting for transactions to get synced " +
888                    " total " + this.unflushedEntries.get() +
889                    " synced till here " + syncedTillHere);
890           sync();
891         }
892         this.writer.close();
893         this.writer = null;
894         closeErrorCount.set(0);
895       } catch (IOException e) {
896         LOG.error("Failed close of HLog writer", e);
897         int errors = closeErrorCount.incrementAndGet();
898         if (errors <= closeErrorsTolerated && !hasDeferredEntries()) {
899           LOG.warn("Riding over HLog close failure! error count="+errors);
900         } else {
901           if (hasDeferredEntries()) {
902             LOG.error("Aborting due to unflushed edits in HLog");
903           }
904           // Failed close of log file.  Means we're losing edits.  For now,
905           // shut ourselves down to minimize loss.  Alternative is to try and
906           // keep going.  See HBASE-930.
907           FailedLogCloseException flce =
908             new FailedLogCloseException("#" + currentfilenum);
909           flce.initCause(e);
910           throw flce;
911         }
912       }
913       if (currentfilenum >= 0) {
914         oldFile = computeFilename(currentfilenum);
915         this.outputfiles.put(Long.valueOf(this.logSeqNum.get()), oldFile);
916       }
917     }
918     return oldFile;
919   }
920 
921   private void archiveLogFile(final Path p, final Long seqno) throws IOException {
922     Path newPath = getHLogArchivePath(this.oldLogDir, p);
923     LOG.info("moving old hlog file " + FSUtils.getPath(p) +
924       " whose highest sequenceid is " + seqno + " to " +
925       FSUtils.getPath(newPath));
926 
927     // Tell our listeners that a log is going to be archived.
928     if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
929       for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
930         i.preLogArchive(p, newPath);
931       }
932     }
933     if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, p, newPath)) {
934       throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + p + " to " + newPath);
935     }
936     // Tell our listeners that a log has been archived.
937     if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
938       for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
939         i.postLogArchive(p, newPath);
940       }
941     }
942   }
943 
944   /**
945    * This is a convenience method that computes a new filename with a given
946    * using the current HLog file-number
947    * @return Path
948    */
949   protected Path computeFilename() {
950     return computeFilename(this.filenum);
951   }
952 
953   /**
954    * This is a convenience method that computes a new filename with a given
955    * file-number.
956    * @param filenum to use
957    * @return Path
958    */
959   protected Path computeFilename(long filenum) {
960     if (filenum < 0) {
961       throw new RuntimeException("hlog file number can't be < 0");
962     }
963     return new Path(dir, prefix + "." + filenum);
964   }
965 
966   /**
967    * Shut down the log and delete the log directory
968    *
969    * @throws IOException
970    */
971   public void closeAndDelete() throws IOException {
972     close();
973     if (!fs.exists(this.dir)) return;
974     FileStatus[] files = fs.listStatus(this.dir);
975     for(FileStatus file : files) {
976 
977       Path p = getHLogArchivePath(this.oldLogDir, file.getPath());
978       // Tell our listeners that a log is going to be archived.
979       if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
980         for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
981           i.preLogArchive(file.getPath(), p);
982         }
983       }
984 
985       if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, file.getPath(), p)) {
986         throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + file.getPath() + " to " + p);
987       }
988       // Tell our listeners that a log was archived.
989       if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
990         for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
991           i.postLogArchive(file.getPath(), p);
992         }
993       }
994     }
995     LOG.debug("Moved " + files.length + " log files to " +
996       FSUtils.getPath(this.oldLogDir));
997     if (!HBaseFileSystem.deleteDirFromFileSystem(fs, dir)) {
998       LOG.info("Unable to delete " + dir);
999     }
1000   }
1001 
1002   /**
1003    * Shut down the log.
1004    *
1005    * @throws IOException
1006    */
1007   public void close() throws IOException {
1008     // When optionalFlushInterval is 0, the logSyncer is not started as a Thread.
1009     if (this.optionalFlushInterval > 0) {
1010       try {
1011         logSyncer.close();
1012         // Make sure we synced everything
1013         logSyncer.join(this.optionalFlushInterval * 2);
1014       } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1015         LOG.error("Exception while waiting for syncer thread to die", e);
1016       }
1017     }
1018 
1019     cacheFlushLock.lock();
1020     try {
1021       // Tell our listeners that the log is closing
1022       if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1023         for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
1024           i.logCloseRequested();
1025         }
1026       }
1027       synchronized (updateLock) {
1028         this.closed = true;
1029         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1030           LOG.debug("closing hlog writer in " + this.dir.toString());
1031         }
1032         if (this.writer != null) {
1033           this.writer.close();
1034         }
1035       }
1036     } finally {
1037       cacheFlushLock.unlock();
1038     }
1039   }
1040 
1041   /**
1042    * @param now
1043    * @param regionName
1044    * @param tableName
1045    * @param clusterId
1046    * @return New log key.
1047    */
1048   protected HLogKey makeKey(byte[] regionName, byte[] tableName, long seqnum,
1049       long now, UUID clusterId) {
1050     return new HLogKey(regionName, tableName, seqnum, now, clusterId);
1051   }
1052 
1053 
1054   /** Append an entry to the log.
1055    *
1056    * @param regionInfo
1057    * @param logEdit
1058    * @param logKey
1059    * @param doSync shall we sync after writing the transaction
1060    * @return The txid of this transaction
1061    * @throws IOException
1062    */
1063   public long append(HRegionInfo regionInfo, HLogKey logKey, WALEdit logEdit,
1064                      HTableDescriptor htd, boolean doSync)
1065   throws IOException {
1066     if (this.closed) {
1067       throw new IOException("Cannot append; log is closed");
1068     }
1069     long txid = 0;
1070     synchronized (updateLock) {
1071       long seqNum = obtainSeqNum();
1072       logKey.setLogSeqNum(seqNum);
1073       // The 'lastSeqWritten' map holds the sequence number of the oldest
1074       // write for each region (i.e. the first edit added to the particular
1075       // memstore). When the cache is flushed, the entry for the
1076       // region being flushed is removed if the sequence number of the flush
1077       // is greater than or equal to the value in lastSeqWritten.
1078       this.lastSeqWritten.putIfAbsent(regionInfo.getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
1079         Long.valueOf(seqNum));
1080       doWrite(regionInfo, logKey, logEdit, htd);
1081       txid = this.unflushedEntries.incrementAndGet();
1082       this.numEntries.incrementAndGet();
1083       if (htd.isDeferredLogFlush()) {
1084         lastDeferredTxid = txid;
1085       }
1086     }
1087 
1088     // Sync if catalog region, and if not then check if that table supports
1089     // deferred log flushing
1090     if (doSync &&
1091         (regionInfo.isMetaRegion() ||
1092         !htd.isDeferredLogFlush())) {
1093       // sync txn to file system
1094       this.sync(txid);
1095     }
1096     return txid;
1097   }
1098 
1099   /**
1100    * Only used in tests.
1101    *
1102    * @param info
1103    * @param tableName
1104    * @param edits
1105    * @param now
1106    * @param htd
1107    * @throws IOException
1108    */
1109   public void append(HRegionInfo info, byte [] tableName, WALEdit edits,
1110     final long now, HTableDescriptor htd)
1111   throws IOException {
1112     append(info, tableName, edits, HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID, now, htd);
1113   }
1114 
1115   /**
1116    * Append a set of edits to the log. Log edits are keyed by (encoded)
1117    * regionName, rowname, and log-sequence-id.
1118    *
1119    * Later, if we sort by these keys, we obtain all the relevant edits for a
1120    * given key-range of the HRegion (TODO). Any edits that do not have a
1121    * matching COMPLETE_CACHEFLUSH message can be discarded.
1122    *
1123    * <p>
1124    * Logs cannot be restarted once closed, or once the HLog process dies. Each
1125    * time the HLog starts, it must create a new log. This means that other
1126    * systems should process the log appropriately upon each startup (and prior
1127    * to initializing HLog).
1128    *
1129    * synchronized prevents appends during the completion of a cache flush or for
1130    * the duration of a log roll.
1131    *
1132    * @param info
1133    * @param tableName
1134    * @param edits
1135    * @param clusterId The originating clusterId for this edit (for replication)
1136    * @param now
1137    * @param doSync shall we sync?
1138    * @return txid of this transaction
1139    * @throws IOException
1140    */
1141   private long append(HRegionInfo info, byte [] tableName, WALEdit edits, UUID clusterId,
1142       final long now, HTableDescriptor htd, boolean doSync)
1143     throws IOException {
1144       if (edits.isEmpty()) return this.unflushedEntries.get();;
1145       if (this.closed) {
1146         throw new IOException("Cannot append; log is closed");
1147       }
1148       long txid = 0;
1149       synchronized (this.updateLock) {
1150         long seqNum = obtainSeqNum();
1151         // The 'lastSeqWritten' map holds the sequence number of the oldest
1152         // write for each region (i.e. the first edit added to the particular
1153         // memstore). . When the cache is flushed, the entry for the
1154         // region being flushed is removed if the sequence number of the flush
1155         // is greater than or equal to the value in lastSeqWritten.
1156         // Use encoded name.  Its shorter, guaranteed unique and a subset of
1157         // actual  name.
1158         byte [] encodedRegionName = info.getEncodedNameAsBytes();
1159         this.lastSeqWritten.putIfAbsent(encodedRegionName, seqNum);
1160         HLogKey logKey = makeKey(encodedRegionName, tableName, seqNum, now, clusterId);
1161         doWrite(info, logKey, edits, htd);
1162         this.numEntries.incrementAndGet();
1163         txid = this.unflushedEntries.incrementAndGet();
1164         if (htd.isDeferredLogFlush()) {
1165           lastDeferredTxid = txid;
1166         }
1167       }
1168       // Sync if catalog region, and if not then check if that table supports
1169       // deferred log flushing
1170       if (doSync && 
1171           (info.isMetaRegion() ||
1172           !htd.isDeferredLogFlush())) {
1173         // sync txn to file system
1174         this.sync(txid);
1175       }
1176       return txid;
1177     }
1178 
1179   /**
1180    * Append a set of edits to the log. Log edits are keyed by (encoded)
1181    * regionName, rowname, and log-sequence-id. The HLog is not flushed
1182    * after this transaction is written to the log.
1183    *
1184    * @param info
1185    * @param tableName
1186    * @param edits
1187    * @param clusterId The originating clusterId for this edit (for replication)
1188    * @param now
1189    * @return txid of this transaction
1190    * @throws IOException
1191    */
1192   public long appendNoSync(HRegionInfo info, byte [] tableName, WALEdit edits, 
1193     UUID clusterId, final long now, HTableDescriptor htd)
1194     throws IOException {
1195     return append(info, tableName, edits, clusterId, now, htd, false);
1196   }
1197 
1198   /**
1199    * Append a set of edits to the log. Log edits are keyed by (encoded)
1200    * regionName, rowname, and log-sequence-id. The HLog is flushed
1201    * after this transaction is written to the log.
1202    *
1203    * @param info
1204    * @param tableName
1205    * @param edits
1206    * @param clusterId The originating clusterId for this edit (for replication)
1207    * @param now
1208    * @return txid of this transaction
1209    * @throws IOException
1210    */
1211   public long append(HRegionInfo info, byte [] tableName, WALEdit edits, 
1212     UUID clusterId, final long now, HTableDescriptor htd)
1213     throws IOException {
1214     return append(info, tableName, edits, clusterId, now, htd, true);
1215   }
1216 
1217   /**
1218    * This class is responsible to hold the HLog's appended Entry list
1219    * and to sync them according to a configurable interval.
1220    *
1221    * Deferred log flushing works first by piggy backing on this process by
1222    * simply not sync'ing the appended Entry. It can also be sync'd by other
1223    * non-deferred log flushed entries outside of this thread.
1224    */
1225   class LogSyncer extends HasThread {
1226 
1227     private final long optionalFlushInterval;
1228 
1229     private AtomicBoolean closeLogSyncer = new AtomicBoolean(false);
1230 
1231     // List of pending writes to the HLog. There corresponds to transactions
1232     // that have not yet returned to the client. We keep them cached here
1233     // instead of writing them to HDFS piecemeal, because the HDFS write 
1234     // method is pretty heavyweight as far as locking is concerned. The 
1235     // goal is to increase the batchsize for writing-to-hdfs as well as
1236     // sync-to-hdfs, so that we can get better system throughput.
1237     private List<Entry> pendingWrites = new LinkedList<Entry>();
1238 
1239     LogSyncer(long optionalFlushInterval) {
1240       this.optionalFlushInterval = optionalFlushInterval;
1241     }
1242 
1243     @Override
1244     public void run() {
1245       try {
1246         // awaiting with a timeout doesn't always
1247         // throw exceptions on interrupt
1248         while(!this.isInterrupted() && !closeLogSyncer.get()) {
1249 
1250           try {
1251             if (unflushedEntries.get() <= syncedTillHere) {
1252               synchronized (closeLogSyncer) {
1253                 closeLogSyncer.wait(this.optionalFlushInterval);
1254               }
1255             }
1256             // Calling sync since we waited or had unflushed entries.
1257             // Entries appended but not sync'd are taken care of here AKA
1258             // deferred log flush
1259             sync();
1260           } catch (IOException e) {
1261             LOG.error("Error while syncing, requesting close of hlog ", e);
1262             requestLogRoll();
1263           }
1264         }
1265       } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1266         LOG.debug(getName() + " interrupted while waiting for sync requests");
1267       } finally {
1268         LOG.info(getName() + " exiting");
1269       }
1270     }
1271 
1272     // appends new writes to the pendingWrites. It is better to keep it in
1273     // our own queue rather than writing it to the HDFS output stream because
1274     // HDFSOutputStream.writeChunk is not lightweight at all.
1275     synchronized void append(Entry e) throws IOException {
1276       pendingWrites.add(e);
1277     }
1278 
1279     // Returns all currently pending writes. New writes
1280     // will accumulate in a new list.
1281     synchronized List<Entry> getPendingWrites() {
1282       List<Entry> save = this.pendingWrites;
1283       this.pendingWrites = new LinkedList<Entry>();
1284       return save;
1285     }
1286 
1287     // writes out pending entries to the HLog
1288     void hlogFlush(Writer writer, List<Entry> pending) throws IOException {
1289       if (pending == null) return;
1290 
1291       // write out all accumulated Entries to hdfs.
1292       for (Entry e : pending) {
1293         writer.append(e);
1294       }
1295     }
1296 
1297     void close() {
1298       synchronized (closeLogSyncer) {
1299         closeLogSyncer.set(true);
1300         closeLogSyncer.notifyAll();
1301       }
1302     }
1303   }
1304 
1305   // sync all known transactions
1306   private void syncer() throws IOException {
1307     syncer(this.unflushedEntries.get()); // sync all pending items
1308   }
1309 
1310   // sync all transactions upto the specified txid
1311   private void syncer(long txid) throws IOException {
1312     Writer tempWriter;
1313     synchronized (this.updateLock) {
1314       if (this.closed) return;
1315       tempWriter = this.writer; // guaranteed non-null
1316     }
1317     // if the transaction that we are interested in is already 
1318     // synced, then return immediately.
1319     if (txid <= this.syncedTillHere) {
1320       return;
1321     }
1322     try {
1323       long doneUpto;
1324       long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1325       // First flush all the pending writes to HDFS. Then 
1326       // issue the sync to HDFS. If sync is successful, then update
1327       // syncedTillHere to indicate that transactions till this
1328       // number has been successfully synced.
1329       IOException ioe = null;
1330       List<Entry> pending = null;
1331       synchronized (flushLock) {
1332         if (txid <= this.syncedTillHere) {
1333           return;
1334         }
1335         doneUpto = this.unflushedEntries.get();
1336         pending = logSyncer.getPendingWrites();
1337         try {
1338           logSyncer.hlogFlush(tempWriter, pending);
1339         } catch(IOException io) {
1340           ioe = io;
1341           LOG.error("syncer encountered error, will retry. txid=" + txid, ioe);
1342         }
1343       }
1344       if (ioe != null && pending != null) {
1345         synchronized (this.updateLock) {
1346           synchronized (flushLock) {
1347             // HBASE-4387, HBASE-5623, retry with updateLock held
1348             tempWriter = this.writer;
1349             logSyncer.hlogFlush(tempWriter, pending);
1350           }
1351         }
1352       }
1353       // another thread might have sync'ed avoid double-sync'ing
1354       if (txid <= this.syncedTillHere) {
1355         return;
1356       }
1357       try {
1358         tempWriter.sync();
1359       } catch (IOException io) {
1360         synchronized (this.updateLock) {
1361           // HBASE-4387, HBASE-5623, retry with updateLock held
1362           tempWriter = this.writer;
1363           tempWriter.sync();
1364         }
1365       }
1366       this.syncedTillHere = Math.max(this.syncedTillHere, doneUpto);
1367 
1368       syncTime.inc(System.currentTimeMillis() - now);
1369       if (!this.logRollRunning) {
1370         checkLowReplication();
1371         try {
1372           if (tempWriter.getLength() > this.logrollsize) {
1373             requestLogRoll();
1374           }
1375         } catch (IOException x) {
1376           LOG.debug("Log roll failed and will be retried. (This is not an error)");
1377         }
1378       }
1379     } catch (IOException e) {
1380       LOG.fatal("Could not sync. Requesting close of hlog", e);
1381       requestLogRoll();
1382       throw e;
1383     }
1384   }
1385 
1386   private void checkLowReplication() {
1387     // if the number of replicas in HDFS has fallen below the configured
1388     // value, then roll logs.
1389     try {
1390       int numCurrentReplicas = getLogReplication();
1391       if (numCurrentReplicas != 0
1392           && numCurrentReplicas < this.minTolerableReplication) {
1393         if (this.lowReplicationRollEnabled) {
1394           if (this.consecutiveLogRolls < this.lowReplicationRollLimit) {
1395             LOG.warn("HDFS pipeline error detected. " + "Found "
1396                 + numCurrentReplicas + " replicas but expecting no less than "
1397                 + this.minTolerableReplication + " replicas. "
1398                 + " Requesting close of hlog.");
1399             requestLogRoll();
1400             // If rollWriter is requested, increase consecutiveLogRolls. Once it
1401             // is larger than lowReplicationRollLimit, disable the
1402             // LowReplication-Roller
1403             this.consecutiveLogRolls++;
1404           } else {
1405             LOG.warn("Too many consecutive RollWriter requests, it's a sign of "
1406                 + "the total number of live datanodes is lower than the tolerable replicas.");
1407             this.consecutiveLogRolls = 0;
1408             this.lowReplicationRollEnabled = false;
1409           }
1410         }
1411       } else if (numCurrentReplicas >= this.minTolerableReplication) {
1412 
1413         if (!this.lowReplicationRollEnabled) {
1414           // The new writer's log replicas is always the default value.
1415           // So we should not enable LowReplication-Roller. If numEntries
1416           // is lower than or equals 1, we consider it as a new writer.
1417           if (this.numEntries.get() <= 1) {
1418             return;
1419           }
1420           // Once the live datanode number and the replicas return to normal,
1421           // enable the LowReplication-Roller.
1422           this.lowReplicationRollEnabled = true;
1423           LOG.info("LowReplication-Roller was enabled.");
1424         }
1425       }
1426     } catch (Exception e) {
1427       LOG.warn("Unable to invoke DFSOutputStream.getNumCurrentReplicas" + e +
1428           " still proceeding ahead...");
1429     }
1430   }
1431 
1432   /**
1433    * This method gets the datanode replication count for the current HLog.
1434    *
1435    * If the pipeline isn't started yet or is empty, you will get the default
1436    * replication factor.  Therefore, if this function returns 0, it means you
1437    * are not properly running with the HDFS-826 patch.
1438    * @throws InvocationTargetException
1439    * @throws IllegalAccessException
1440    * @throws IllegalArgumentException
1441    *
1442    * @throws Exception
1443    */
1444   int getLogReplication()
1445   throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
1446     if (this.getNumCurrentReplicas != null && this.hdfs_out != null) {
1447       Object repl = this.getNumCurrentReplicas.invoke(getOutputStream(), NO_ARGS);
1448       if (repl instanceof Integer) {
1449         return ((Integer)repl).intValue();
1450       }
1451     }
1452     return 0;
1453   }
1454 
1455   boolean canGetCurReplicas() {
1456     return this.getNumCurrentReplicas != null;
1457   }
1458 
1459   public void hsync() throws IOException {
1460     syncer();
1461   }
1462 
1463   public void hflush() throws IOException {
1464     syncer();
1465   }
1466 
1467   public void sync() throws IOException {
1468     syncer();
1469   }
1470 
1471   public void sync(long txid) throws IOException {
1472     syncer(txid);
1473   }
1474 
1475   private void requestLogRoll() {
1476     if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1477       for (WALActionsListener i: this.listeners) {
1478         i.logRollRequested();
1479       }
1480     }
1481   }
1482 
1483   protected void doWrite(HRegionInfo info, HLogKey logKey, WALEdit logEdit,
1484                            HTableDescriptor htd)
1485   throws IOException {
1486     if (!this.enabled) {
1487       return;
1488     }
1489     if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1490       for (WALActionsListener i: this.listeners) {
1491         i.visitLogEntryBeforeWrite(htd, logKey, logEdit);
1492       }
1493     }
1494     try {
1495       long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1496       // coprocessor hook:
1497       if (!coprocessorHost.preWALWrite(info, logKey, logEdit)) {
1498         // write to our buffer for the Hlog file.
1499         logSyncer.append(new HLog.Entry(logKey, logEdit));
1500       }
1501       long took = System.currentTimeMillis() - now;
1502       coprocessorHost.postWALWrite(info, logKey, logEdit);
1503       writeTime.inc(took);
1504       long len = 0;
1505       for (KeyValue kv : logEdit.getKeyValues()) {
1506         len += kv.getLength();
1507       }
1508       writeSize.inc(len);
1509       if (took > 1000) {
1510         LOG.warn(String.format(
1511           "%s took %d ms appending an edit to hlog; editcount=%d, len~=%s",
1512           Thread.currentThread().getName(), took, this.numEntries.get(),
1513           StringUtils.humanReadableInt(len)));
1514         slowHLogAppendCount.incrementAndGet();
1515         slowHLogAppendTime.inc(took);
1516       }
1517     } catch (IOException e) {
1518       LOG.fatal("Could not append. Requesting close of hlog", e);
1519       requestLogRoll();
1520       throw e;
1521     }
1522   }
1523 
1524 
1525   /** @return How many items have been added to the log */
1526   int getNumEntries() {
1527     return numEntries.get();
1528   }
1529 
1530   /**
1531    * Obtain a log sequence number.
1532    */
1533   private long obtainSeqNum() {
1534     return this.logSeqNum.incrementAndGet();
1535   }
1536 
1537   /** @return the number of log files in use */
1538   int getNumLogFiles() {
1539     return outputfiles.size();
1540   }
1541 
1542   private byte[] getSnapshotName(byte[] encodedRegionName) {
1543     byte snp[] = new byte[encodedRegionName.length + 3];
1544     // an encoded region name has only hex digits. s, n or p are not hex
1545     // and therefore snapshot-names will never collide with
1546     // encoded-region-names
1547     snp[0] = 's'; snp[1] = 'n'; snp[2] = 'p';
1548     for (int i = 0; i < encodedRegionName.length; i++) {
1549       snp[i+3] = encodedRegionName[i];
1550     }
1551     return snp;
1552   }
1553 
1554   /**
1555    * By acquiring a log sequence ID, we can allow log messages to continue while
1556    * we flush the cache.
1557    *
1558    * Acquire a lock so that we do not roll the log between the start and
1559    * completion of a cache-flush. Otherwise the log-seq-id for the flush will
1560    * not appear in the correct logfile.
1561    *
1562    * Ensuring that flushes and log-rolls don't happen concurrently also allows
1563    * us to temporarily put a log-seq-number in lastSeqWritten against the region
1564    * being flushed that might not be the earliest in-memory log-seq-number for
1565    * that region. By the time the flush is completed or aborted and before the
1566    * cacheFlushLock is released it is ensured that lastSeqWritten again has the
1567    * oldest in-memory edit's lsn for the region that was being flushed.
1568    *
1569    * In this method, by removing the entry in lastSeqWritten for the region
1570    * being flushed we ensure that the next edit inserted in this region will be
1571    * correctly recorded in {@link #append(HRegionInfo, byte[], WALEdit, long, HTableDescriptor)} The
1572    * lsn of the earliest in-memory lsn - which is now in the memstore snapshot -
1573    * is saved temporarily in the lastSeqWritten map while the flush is active.
1574    *
1575    * @return sequence ID to pass
1576    *         {@link #completeCacheFlush(byte[], byte[], long, boolean)} (byte[],
1577    *         byte[], long)}
1578    * @see #completeCacheFlush(byte[], byte[], long, boolean)
1579    * @see #abortCacheFlush(byte[])
1580    */
1581   public long startCacheFlush(final byte[] encodedRegionName) {
1582     this.cacheFlushLock.lock();
1583     Long seq = this.lastSeqWritten.remove(encodedRegionName);
1584     // seq is the lsn of the oldest edit associated with this region. If a
1585     // snapshot already exists - because the last flush failed - then seq will
1586     // be the lsn of the oldest edit in the snapshot
1587     if (seq != null) {
1588       // keeping the earliest sequence number of the snapshot in
1589       // lastSeqWritten maintains the correctness of
1590       // getOldestOutstandingSeqNum(). But it doesn't matter really because
1591       // everything is being done inside of cacheFlush lock.
1592       Long oldseq =
1593         lastSeqWritten.put(getSnapshotName(encodedRegionName), seq);
1594       if (oldseq != null) {
1595         LOG.error("Logic Error Snapshot seq id from earlier flush still" +
1596             " present! for region " + Bytes.toString(encodedRegionName) +
1597             " overwritten oldseq=" + oldseq + "with new seq=" + seq);
1598         Runtime.getRuntime().halt(1);
1599       }
1600     }
1601     return obtainSeqNum();
1602   }
1603 
1604 
1605   /**
1606    * Complete the cache flush
1607    *
1608    * Protected by cacheFlushLock
1609    *
1610    * @param encodedRegionName
1611    * @param tableName
1612    * @param logSeqId
1613    * @throws IOException
1614    */
1615   public void completeCacheFlush(final byte [] encodedRegionName,
1616       final byte [] tableName, final long logSeqId, final boolean isMetaRegion)
1617   throws IOException {
1618     try {
1619       if (this.closed) {
1620         return;
1621       }
1622       long txid = 0;
1623       synchronized (updateLock) {
1624         long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1625         WALEdit edit = completeCacheFlushLogEdit();
1626         HLogKey key = makeKey(encodedRegionName, tableName, logSeqId,
1627             System.currentTimeMillis(), HConstants.DEFAULT_CLUSTER_ID);
1628         logSyncer.append(new Entry(key, edit));
1629         txid = this.unflushedEntries.incrementAndGet();
1630         writeTime.inc(System.currentTimeMillis() - now);
1631         long len = 0;
1632         for (KeyValue kv : edit.getKeyValues()) {
1633           len += kv.getLength();
1634         }
1635         writeSize.inc(len);
1636         this.numEntries.incrementAndGet();
1637       }
1638       // sync txn to file system
1639       this.sync(txid);
1640 
1641     } finally {
1642       // updateLock not needed for removing snapshot's entry
1643       // Cleaning up of lastSeqWritten is in the finally clause because we
1644       // don't want to confuse getOldestOutstandingSeqNum()
1645       this.lastSeqWritten.remove(getSnapshotName(encodedRegionName));
1646       this.cacheFlushLock.unlock();
1647     }
1648   }
1649 
1650   private WALEdit completeCacheFlushLogEdit() {
1651     KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(METAROW, METAFAMILY, null,
1652       System.currentTimeMillis(), COMPLETE_CACHE_FLUSH);
1653     WALEdit e = new WALEdit();
1654     e.add(kv);
1655     return e;
1656   }
1657 
1658   /**
1659    * Abort a cache flush.
1660    * Call if the flush fails. Note that the only recovery for an aborted flush
1661    * currently is a restart of the regionserver so the snapshot content dropped
1662    * by the failure gets restored to the memstore.
1663    */
1664   public void abortCacheFlush(byte[] encodedRegionName) {
1665     Long snapshot_seq =
1666       this.lastSeqWritten.remove(getSnapshotName(encodedRegionName));
1667     if (snapshot_seq != null) {
1668       // updateLock not necessary because we are racing against
1669       // lastSeqWritten.putIfAbsent() in append() and we will always win
1670       // before releasing cacheFlushLock make sure that the region's entry in
1671       // lastSeqWritten points to the earliest edit in the region
1672       Long current_memstore_earliest_seq =
1673         this.lastSeqWritten.put(encodedRegionName, snapshot_seq);
1674       if (current_memstore_earliest_seq != null &&
1675           (current_memstore_earliest_seq.longValue() <=
1676             snapshot_seq.longValue())) {
1677         LOG.error("Logic Error region " + Bytes.toString(encodedRegionName) +
1678             "acquired edits out of order current memstore seq=" +
1679             current_memstore_earliest_seq + " snapshot seq=" + snapshot_seq);
1680         Runtime.getRuntime().halt(1);
1681       }
1682     }
1683     this.cacheFlushLock.unlock();
1684   }
1685

1687    * @param family
1688    * @return true if the column is a meta column
1689    */
1690   public static boolean isMetaFamily(byte [] family) {
1691     return Bytes.equals(METAFAMILY, family);
1692   }

1700     return lowReplicationRollEnabled;

1703   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1704   public static Class<? extends HLogKey> getKeyClass(Configuration conf) {
1705      return (Class<? extends HLogKey>)
1706        conf.getClass("hbase.regionserver.hlog.keyclass", HLogKey.class);
1707   }
1708 
1709   public static HLogKey newKey(Configuration conf) throws IOException {
1710     Class<? extends HLogKey> keyClass = getKeyClass(conf);
1711     try {
1712       return keyClass.newInstance();
1713     } catch (InstantiationException e) {
1714       throw new IOException("cannot create hlog key");
1715     } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
1716       throw new IOException("cannot create hlog key");
1717     }
1718   }

1720   /**
1721    * Utility class that lets us keep track of the edit with it's key
1722    * Only used when splitting logs
1723    */
1724   public static class Entry implements Writable {
1725     private WALEdit edit;
1726     private HLogKey key;
1727 
1728     public Entry() {
1729       edit = new WALEdit();
1730       key = new HLogKey();
1731     }
1732 
1733     /**
1734      * Constructor for both params
1735      * @param edit log's edit
1736      * @param key log's key
1737      */
1738     public Entry(HLogKey key, WALEdit edit) {
1739       super();
1740       this.key = key;
1741       this.edit = edit;
1742     }
1743     /**
1744      * Gets the edit
1745      * @return edit
1746      */
1747     public WALEdit getEdit() {
1748       return edit;
1749     }
1750     /**
1751      * Gets the key
1752      * @return key
1753      */
1754     public HLogKey getKey() {
1755       return key;
1756     }
1757 
1758     /**
1759      * Set compression context for this entry.
1760      * @param compressionContext Compression context
1761      */
1762     public void setCompressionContext(CompressionContext compressionContext) {
1763       edit.setCompressionContext(compressionContext);
1764       key.setCompressionContext(compressionContext);
1765     }
1766 
1767     @Override
1768     public String toString() {
1769       return this.key + "=" + this.edit;
1770     }
1771 
1772     @Override
1773     public void write(DataOutput dataOutput) throws IOException {
1774       this.key.write(dataOutput);
1775       this.edit.write(dataOutput);
1776     }
1777 
1778     @Override
1779     public void readFields(DataInput dataInput) throws IOException {
1780       this.key.readFields(dataInput);
1781       this.edit.readFields(dataInput);
1782     }
1783   }

1791   public static String getHLogDirectoryName(final String serverName) {
1792     StringBuilder dirName = new StringBuilder(HConstants.HREGION_LOGDIR_NAME);
1793     dirName.append("/");
1794     dirName.append(serverName);
1795     return dirName.toString();
1796   }

1810    *         otherwise

1812   public static boolean validateHLogFilename(String filename) {
1813     return pattern.matcher(filename).matches();

1820   static String formatRecoveredEditsFileName(final long seqid) {
1821     return String.format("%019d", seqid);
1822   }
1823 
1824   /**
1825    * Returns sorted set of edit files made by wal-log splitter, excluding files
1826    * with '.temp' suffix.
1827    * @param fs
1828    * @param regiondir
1829    * @return Files in passed <code>regiondir</code> as a sorted set.
1830    * @throws IOException
1831    */
1832   public static NavigableSet<Path> getSplitEditFilesSorted(final FileSystem fs,
1833       final Path regiondir)
1834   throws IOException {
1835     NavigableSet<Path> filesSorted = new TreeSet<Path>();
1836     Path editsdir = getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(regiondir);
1837     if (!fs.exists(editsdir)) return filesSorted;
1838     FileStatus[] files = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, editsdir, new PathFilter() {
1839       @Override
1840       public boolean accept(Path p) {
1841         boolean result = false;
1842         try {
1843           // Return files and only files that match the editfile names pattern.
1844           // There can be other files in this directory other than edit files.
1845           // In particular, on error, we'll move aside the bad edit file giving
1846           // it a timestamp suffix.  See moveAsideBadEditsFile.
1847           Matcher m = EDITFILES_NAME_PATTERN.matcher(p.getName());
1848           result = fs.isFile(p) && m.matches();
1849           // Skip the file whose name ends with RECOVERED_LOG_TMPFILE_SUFFIX,
1850           // because it means splithlog thread is writting this file.
1851           if (p.getName().endsWith(RECOVERED_LOG_TMPFILE_SUFFIX)) {
1852             result = false;
1853           }
1854         } catch (IOException e) {
1855           LOG.warn("Failed isFile check on " + p);
1856         }
1857         return result;
1858       }
1859     });
1860     if (files == null) return filesSorted;
1861     for (FileStatus status: files) {
1862       filesSorted.add(status.getPath());
1863     }
1864     return filesSorted;
1865   }
1866 
1867   /**
1868    * Move aside a bad edits file.
1869    * @param fs
1870    * @param edits Edits file to move aside.
1871    * @return The name of the moved aside file.
1872    * @throws IOException
1873    */
1874   public static Path moveAsideBadEditsFile(final FileSystem fs,
1875       final Path edits)
1876   throws IOException {
1877     Path moveAsideName = new Path(edits.getParent(), edits.getName() + "." +
1878       System.currentTimeMillis());
1879     if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, edits, moveAsideName)) {
1880       LOG.warn("Rename failed from " + edits + " to " + moveAsideName);
1881     }
1882     return moveAsideName;
1883   }
1884 
1885   /**
1886    * @param regiondir This regions directory in the filesystem.
1887    * @return The directory that holds recovered edits files for the region
1888    * <code>regiondir</code>
1889    */
1890   public static Path getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(final Path regiondir) {
1891     return new Path(regiondir, RECOVERED_EDITS_DIR);
1892   }
1893 
1894   public static final long FIXED_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.align(
1895     ClassSize.OBJECT + (5 * ClassSize.REFERENCE) +
1896     ClassSize.ATOMIC_INTEGER + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT + (3 * Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG));
1897 
1898   private static void usage() {
1899     System.err.println("Usage: HLog <ARGS>");
1900     System.err.println("Arguments:");
1901     System.err.println(" --dump  Dump textual representation of passed one or more files");
1902     System.err.println("         For example: HLog --dump hdfs://example.com:9000/hbase/.logs/MACHINE/LOGFILE");
1903     System.err.println(" --split Split the passed directory of WAL logs");
1904     System.err.println("         For example: HLog --split hdfs://example.com:9000/hbase/.logs/DIR");
1905   }
1906 
1907   private static void split(final Configuration conf, final Path p)
1908   throws IOException {
1909     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
1910     if (!fs.exists(p)) {
1911       throw new FileNotFoundException(p.toString());
1912     }
1913     final Path baseDir = new Path(conf.get(HConstants.HBASE_DIR));
1914     final Path oldLogDir = new Path(baseDir, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME);
1915     if (!fs.getFileStatus(p).isDir()) {
1916       throw new IOException(p + " is not a directory");
1917     }
1918 
1919     HLogSplitter logSplitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(
1920         conf, baseDir, p, oldLogDir, fs);
1921     logSplitter.splitLog();
1922   }
1923 
1924   /**
1925    * @return Coprocessor host.
1926    */
1927   public WALCoprocessorHost getCoprocessorHost() {
1928     return coprocessorHost;
1929   }
1930 
1931   /** Provide access to currently deferred sequence num for tests */
1932   boolean hasDeferredEntries() {
1933     return lastDeferredTxid > syncedTillHere;
1934   }
1935 
1936   /**
1937    * Pass one or more log file names and it will either dump out a text version
1938    * on <code>stdout</code> or split the specified log files.
1939    *
1940    * @param args
1941    * @throws IOException
1942    */
1943   public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
1944     if (args.length < 2) {
1945       usage();
1946       System.exit(-1);
1947     }
1948     // either dump using the HLogPrettyPrinter or split, depending on args
1949     if (args[0].compareTo("--dump") == 0) {
1950       HLogPrettyPrinter.run(Arrays.copyOfRange(args, 1, args.length));
1951     } else if (args[0].compareTo("--split") == 0) {
1952       Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
1953       for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
1954         try {
1955           conf.set("fs.default.name", args[i]);
1956           conf.set("fs.defaultFS", args[i]);
1957           Path logPath = new Path(args[i]);
1958           split(conf, logPath);
1959         } catch (Throwable t) {
1960           t.printStackTrace(System.err);
1961           System.exit(-1);
1962         }
1963       }
1964     } else {
1965       usage();
1966       System.exit(-1);
1967     }
1968   }
1969 }
